plugin_desc: Used to collect and monitor key metrics for MySQL database health and performance.
name: Mysql

metrics.name: mysql_aborted_clients
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of connections aborted due to client errors. Monitoring this metric can help identify connection reliability issues.

metrics.name: mysql_aborted_connects
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of connection attempts aborted due to connection issues. High values may indicate configuration issues or server overload.

metrics.name: mysql_access_denied_errors
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of access denials due to insufficient privileges or authentication failures. Monitoring this metric helps in identifying and resolving permission issues.

metrics.name: mysql_aria_pagecache_blocks_unused
metrics.description: This metric indicates the number of unused page cache blocks in the Aria storage engine. Monitoring this metric helps optimize cache allocation.

metrics.name: mysql_aria_pagecache_blocks_used
metrics.description: This metric indicates the number of used page cache blocks in the Aria storage engine. Monitoring this metric helps assess the effective utilization of the cache.

metrics.name: mysql_bytes_received
metrics.description: This metric indicates the number of bytes received by the MySQL server. Monitoring this metric helps understand the network traffic load.

metrics.name: mysql_bytes_sent
metrics.description: This metric indicates the number of bytes sent by the MySQL server. Monitoring this metric helps understand the network traffic load.

metrics.name: mysql_com_select
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of Select queries executed. Monitoring this metric helps understand the frequency of read operations and system load.

metrics.name: mysql_com_insert
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of Insert commands executed. Monitoring this metric helps understand the frequency of write operations and system load.

metrics.name: mysql_com_update
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of Update commands executed. Monitoring this metric helps understand the frequency of update operations and system load.

metrics.name: mysql_com_delete
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of Delete commands executed. Monitoring this metric helps understand the frequency of delete operations and system load.

metrics.name: mysql_connections_total
metrics.description: This metric represents the total number of connections created since the server started. Monitoring the total connections helps understand connection patterns and load.
